ygData.subject: Re: How can I create a complete graph in Heritrix?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Travis, Thanks for the answer. I ll make this after the re-crawling because I disabled the WARCWriteProcessor in the first crawl. I ll return the results

Hi Travis,

Thanks for the answer. I'll make this after the "re-crawling" b=
ecause I disabled the WARCWriteProcessor in the first crawl. 
I'll return t=
he results to this post when I finish the graph.

Thanks again. :)

Att.
El=
verton.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, travis@... wrote:
>
> Elve=
rton,
> 
> Have you looked at the metadata in the warcs? Each record should=
 list
> extracted links regardless of whether they were crawled due to scop=
ing rules.
> Extract this set and intersect it with actual crawled uris to =
obtain a full
> graph within what was crawled. You may also consider that t=
he extractor also
> has a [high] limit on the number of URIs it extracts.
>=
 
> Travis
> 
> On Mon, February 27, 2012 11:45 am, Elverton wrote:
> > Hel=
lo everybody,
> >
> > As I sent a email to Gordon this afternoon (below), I=
 want to record and get
> > suggestion how can I get more information about=
 a URI before it get 'uniqued'.
> > As I read at "Mohr-et-al-2004', the way=
 to decide what to do with a URI is at
> > Prefetch, more exactly in Presel=
ector. But I don't have a clue what filter or
> > rule can help me. Any sug=
gestions?
> >
> > Att.
> > Elverton.
> >
> > =3D> The original message:
> >=
 ---------------------------------------------------------------
> >  Hello=
 Gordon,
> >
> >  My name is Elverton. I'm doing a research in a metric to =
estimate the numbers
> > of URL of a domain. I have a problem to solve and =
you think you can help me.
> >
> >  I want to make a complete graph of all =
URL's collected but all I have from
> > crawl.log is the "father" of the UR=
L and the URL. This would be necessary but
> > I have an misundertanding ab=
out one thing: If heritrix collect one URL,
> > suppose "yahoo.com" from "g=
oogle.com". If the heritrix enter in "amazon.com"
> > and found "yahoo.com"=
 again, in crawl.log will appear:
> >
> >  - - - yahoo.com - google.com
> >=
  - - - yahoo.com - amazon.com
> >
> >  or only:
> >
> >  - - - yahoo.com -=
 google.com
> >
> >  So, the heritrix will ignore the found in "amazon.com"=
 because it was already
> > found in "google.com"?
> >
> >  Att.
> >  Elver=
ton.
> >
> > --------------------------------------------------------------=
-
> >
> > =3D> Gordon's answer:
> >
> > -----------------------------------=
----------------------------
> >
> > You're correct, the crawl.log is not e=
nough info to make a full web
> > graph... it only records the exact paths =
that led to a URI being first
> > discovered. You'd need to log more from t=
he crawler before it 'uniques'
> > the URIs for crawling purposes, or perfo=
rm a post-crawl analysis on the
> > full link-containing content, to create=
 the web graph.
> >
> > - Gordon
> >
> > ----------------------------------=
-----------------------------
> >
> >
>
